name: Cockatrice 2.6.1: Father of Ruins, Revision 1
body:
Supported Operating Systems:
 • Windows 7 & newer
 • macOS 10.11 ("El Capitan") & newer
 • Ubuntu 16.04 LTS ("Xenial Xerus") only
## General Notes We're pleased to announce the newest official release: **Cockatrice: Father of Ruins, Revision 1** We hope you enjoy the changes made and we have listed all changes, with their corresponding tickets, since the last version of Cockatrice was released for your convenience. If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues). ([How to create a GitHub Ticket for Cockatrice](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/How-to-Create-a-GitHub-Ticket-Regarding-Cockatrice)) For any information relating to Cockatrice, please take a look at our official site: **https://cockatrice.github.io** If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in any way, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works and how you can provide a meaningful contribution. ## Upgrading Cockatrice >⚠️ **With this release, we no longer provide a ready-to-install binary for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.** You can still [manually compile](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Compiling-Cockatrice-(Linux)) for this and many other linux distributions. > >We now offer a pre-compiled `.deb` file for *Ubuntu 16.04 LTS* instead. - Run the internal software updater: Help → Check for Client Updates After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) as well (run `Oracle` tool): - Windows & Linux: Cockatrice → Check for card updates... - macOS: Actions → Check for card updates... ## Changelog ### User Interface - Chat macros now editable. #3298 - Tip of the day closes with main window. #3305 ### Under the Hood - Fixed! Fix faulty popups for no card database, as well as token creation. #3307 - Reinstall button fixed. #3297 - Tap/Untap hard locked to grid. #3299 - Win32/64 NSIS install script changes. #3300, #3323, #3325, #3331 - MacOS packaging fixes. #3302 - Include 2.6.1 update flag. #3316 - Ubuntu Linux updated from 14.04 to 16.04. #3320, #3321 - Appveyor updates & cleanup. #3324, #3334 - Remove Qt guards as no longer necessary. #3328 ### Oracle - No updates at this time ### Servatrice - No updates at this time ### Webatrice - No updates at this time ## Translations - **Thanks for over 200 people contributing to 20+ different languages up to now!** - Without the help of the community we couldn't offer that great language support... keep up the good work! - It's actually very easy to join and help for yourself - find out more here: - [Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ) ## Special Thanks We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ZeldaZach, @Tooomm, @Daenyth, and @ctrlaltca for their continued support of Cockatrice development.

We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works and how you can provide a meaningful contribution. ## Upgrading Cockatrice - Run the internal software updater: Help → Check for Client Updates After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) as well (run `Oracle` tool): - Windows & Linux: Cockatrice → Check for card updates... - macOS: Actions → Check for card updates... ## Changelog ### User Interface - Spoiler update datetime fixed for non-Unix systems. #3204 - Log pruning. #3207 - Connection dialog window updates. #3211, #3243 - Remove brackets from card CMCs when unnecessary. #3217 - Settings dialog cleanup. #3220, #3245 - New! Search feature in "Manage sets" dialog. #3229 - Unused fields hidden from popup card dialog. #3239 - Resolved! Duplicate card databases on reloads fixed. #3283 - New icons. #3289 ### Under the Hood - Moderation logging. #3215 - macOS better install methods. #3216 - Parsers now loaded as modules. #3223 - Cmake script fixes. #3230, #3275 - Appveyor script fixes. #3232, #3251, #3265, #3269 - Better handling of power/toughness filtering. #3250 - Code cleanup. #3261 - Archlinux complication fixes. #3270 - Minimum version field. #3287 ### Oracle - No updates at this time ### Servatrice - Configure connection points to the server. #3242 - Validation of column ordering in SQL. #3249 ### Webatrice - No updates at this time ### Translations - **Thanks for over 100 people contributing to many different translations up to now!** - Without the help of the community we couldn't offer that great language support... keep up the good work! - It's actually very easy to join and help for yourself - find out more here: - [Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ) ## Special Thanks We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ZeldaZach, @Tooomm, @Daenyth, and @Vafthrudnir for their continued support of Cockatrice development.

name: Cockatrice 2.5.0: Decked Out
body:
## General Notes

We're pleased to announce the newest official release: <kbd>**Cockatrice: Decked Out**</kbd>

We hope you enjoy the changes made and we have listed all changes, with their corresponding tickets, since the last version of Cockatrice was released for your convenience.

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues). ([How to create a GitHub Ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/How-to-Create-a-GitHub-Ticket))

For any information relating to Cockatrice, please take a look at our official site: **https://cockatrice.github.io**

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in any way, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works and how you can provide a meaningful contribution.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

>⚠️ We have dropped support for Windows Vista and XP with #2975.
Users on these operating systems can get the final compatible download from our [2.3.17](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/releases/tag/2017-05-05-Release-2.3.17) release.

- Run the internal software updater: <kbd>Help → Check for Client Updates</kbd>

After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) as well (run `Oracle` tool):
- Windows & Linux: <kbd>Cockatrice → Check for card updates...</kbd>
- macOS: <kbd>Actions → Check for card updates...</kbd>

## Changelog

### User Interface
- <kbd>New!</kbd> Automatic spoiler season! #2991 
- <kbd>New!</kbd> Tips of the Day to help users with common issues! #3118
- Deck Editor major changes:
    - Deck editor filter upgrades. #2961, #2987, #3000, #3003, #3072, #3074  
        - Can now use `>=`, `>`, `<`, `<=` on most filters. #3080 
        - Loyalty filter added. #3087 
        - Split card handling improved. #3090, #3098  
        - Smarter mana cost sorting. #3008
        - Clear filters w/ backspace or delete. #2959, #3097
        - Rarity filters make sense now. #2962 
    - Deck export upgrades. #2938, #2944, #3013 
    - Deck Editor comments field resizable. #3105 
    - Mana cost corrections for hybrids. #3108 
    - Right click menu options for Deck Editor. #3113 
    - Shortcuts remapped. #3116
- Flush debug log option. #2963
- Tap/Untap options combined. #2964 
- System architecture shown in client and better debug log. #2968, #2981 
- Token dialog updates. #2999, #3044, #3077 
- Sideboard button disabled pre-game. #3025
- Domain updates for a server. #3051
- First time users will start in full screen. #3075 
- Mac QT issues resolved. #3095 
- Copy card name to chat window. #3106
- View related cards instead of having to create tokens. #3115 
- Flipping a card face up will include P/T. #3122 

### Under the Hood
- Split card updates. #2949 
- Deck Editor Non-db cards can change zones. #2960
- Update semver handling. #2980
- Smarter deck parsing. #3007, #3057
- Crash fixes. #3011, #3053, #3077
- Connection dialog parsing. #3018
- Clang-format code base. #3028, #3085, #3122 
- Package name change. #3079 
- Build cleanups. #3081 
- Fixed CUSTOM path on Windows. #3119 

### Oracle
- Clarify wording. #2946, #3109 
- Split card improvements. #3102 
- Table row improvements. #3104 

### Servatrice
- No updates at this time

### Webatrice
- No updates at this time

### Translations
- **Thanks for over 100 people contributing to many different translations up to now!**
- Without the help of the community we couldn't offer that great language support... keep up the good work!
- It's actually very easy to join and help for yourself - find out more here:
    - [Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

## Special Thanks
We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ZeldaZach, @Tooomm, @Daenyth, and @Vafthrudnir for their continued support of Cockatrice development.

name: Cockatrice 2.4.0: Unwrapped
body:
## General Notes

> If you still need a Windows XP compatible version, check the former **[Cockatrice 2.3.17](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/releases/tag/2017-05-05-Release-2.3.17)** instead!

We're pleased to announce the newest official release: <kbd>**Cockatrice: Unwrapped**</kbd>

We hope you enjoy the changes made and we have listed all changes, with their corresponding tickets, since the last version of Cockatrice was released for your convenience.

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues). ([How to create a GitHub Ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/How-to-Create-a-GitHub-Ticket))

For any information relating to Cockatrice, please take a look at our official site: **https://cockatrice.github.io**

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in any way, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works and how you can provide a meaningful contribution.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

- Run the internal software updater: <kbd>Help → Check for Client Updates</kbd>

After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) as well (run `Oracle` tool):
- Windows & Linux: <kbd>Cockatrice → Check for card updates...</kbd>
- macOS: <kbd>Actions → Check for card updates...</kbd>

## Changelog

### User Interface
- Enhanced game log formatting #2686
- Don't ping users with server tab on login #2688
- Can link to cards case insensitive & punctuation insensitive #2706, #2752
- Only show "remove counters" option if counters on card #2714 
- Better scrolling in reveal zones window #2716
- Context menu cleanup #2719
- Update dialog changes #2723 
- <kbd>New!</kbd> Colorless filter in deck editor #2737, #2858 
- Context menu updates regarding token and cloning #2744, #2813, #2824 
- Loading a deck un-hides the dock #2745
- <kbd>New!</kbd> Cards set to not untap normally have pink border #2746
- Token dialog update #2751, #2815
- Registration dialog error clarifications #2760
- Improved related cards (token) handling #2773
- Flag fixes #2804 
- Don't update own counters if you click on opponent's #2839
- Deck editor correctly sorts by P/T #2901

### Under the Hood
- Room chat history fixed #2698
- Message window updates #2709
- Client version in logs #2750
- Remove invalid timers #2753
- Remove old BinTray objects #2757
- <kbd>New!</kbd> High quality image support (.xlhq) #2778
- XSD updates #2781, #2785, #2787
- Spoiler XML policies #2784
- <kbd>New!</kbd> Portable mode on Windows  #2794
- Ignore incomplete unknown sets #2797
- Fix errors with log #2817 
- <kbd>New!</kbd> Additional shortcut options #2821 
- AppVeyor updates #2859, #2878, #2885, #2888, #2892
- Case insensitive email reset #2860
- HTTPS links #2863
- <kbd>Resolved!</kbd> Life count fixed #2881
- <kbd>Resolved!</kbd> Fix Deckstats.net analysis #2886 
- ReadMe style update #2905
- Deck save defaults to .cod format #2910 

### Oracle
- Display current version of Oracle #2818 

### Webatrice
- Overhaul of service #2735, #2742

### Translations
Regarding the ongoing (and upcoming) raids in Ixalan check out `Pirate English`, arrr! ;)
- **Thanks for over 100 people contributing to many different translations up to now!**
- Without the help of the community we couldn't offer that great language support... keep up the good work!
- It's actually very easy to join and help for yourself - find out more here:
    - [Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

## Special Thanks
We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ZeldaZach, @Tooomm, @Daenyth, @WoogerBoy21 and @JJCard for their continued support of Cockatrice development.

name: Cockatrice: Trials of the Gods
body: ## General Notes ⚠️ This is the last supported release for Windows XP! We're pleased to announce the newest official release: **Cockatrice: Trials of the Gods** We hope you enjoy the changes made and we have listed all changes, with their corresponding tickets, since the last version of Cockatrice was released for your convenience. If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues). ([How to create a GitHub Ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/How-to-Create-a-GitHub-Ticket)) For any information relating to Cockatrice, please take a look at our official site: **https://cockatrice.github.io** If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in any way, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works and how you can provide a meaningful contribution. ## Upgrading Cockatrice - Run the internal software updater: Help → Check for Client Updates After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) as well (run `Oracle` tool): - Windows & Linux: Cockatrice → Check for card updates... - macOS: Actions → Check for card updates... ## Changelog ### User Interface - Show better information in version window / installer. #2570 - Revert focus deselection of in game chat. #2583, #2604, #2619 - Disable buttons if spectator is off / game is full. #2605, #2636 - New! Can now move cards between main board and sideboard by double clicking. #2606 - Specify why a user left a room (kicked, left, disconnect, etc). #2633 - Tokens that are not in the XML will now show the name given to them. #2638, #2643, #2646 - Useful for die rolls, as it will show the number even if you have names off. - New! Token dialog now gives a preview, woohoo! #2639 - Can now sort sets by enabled. #2648 - New! New option to select a random card from a graveyard. #2652 - Clear button for card search in deck editor. #2654 - Hide Ready/Not-Ready buttons for spectators. #2656 - New! New option to place a card X cards deep in a deck. #2666, #2674 ### Under the Hood - Trim white space from deck names on save. #2634 - Fix more replay crashes. #2649 - Fix cards getting random power/toughness (rarely). #2650 - Fix crash with in client logger. Logger now is modal-less. #2659 - Token loading fixed for "plain text" decks #2670 - Card price code removed. #2670 - Make debugging a little less cluttered. #2683 ### Oracle - Resolved! Handle "Aftermath" cards correctly (similar to split cards). #2626 ### Translations - **Thanks for over 100 people contributing to many different translations up to now!** - Without the help of the community we couldn't offer that great language support... keep up the good work! - It's actually very easy to join and help for yourself - find out more here: - [Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ) ## Special Thanks We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ctrlaltca @ZeldaZach and @tooomm for their continued support of Cockatrice development.

We're pleased to announce the newest official release: <kbd>**Cockatrice: Thopter Pie Network**</kbd>! We hope you enjoy the changes made, and we have listed all changes since the last Revision of Cockatrice was released, with their corresponding tickets, for your convenience.

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues). ([How to create a GitHub Ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/How-to-Create-a-GitHub-Ticket))

For any information relating to Cockatrice, please take a look at our official site: **https://cockatrice.github.io**

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works and how you can provide a meaningful contribution.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

Go to <kbd>Help → Update Cockatrice</kbd> and you'll be taken through the update steps in client.

After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) (run <kbd>Oracle</kbd>).

## Changelog

### Major Changes
- Release channels for updating. #2362, #2468 
   - You can now choose whether to get updates from the stable master or experimental development branches.

### User Interface
- Player number count added in game. #2435
- Forgot password feature. #2393 
- Program names capitalized (`oracle` -> `Oracle`, `cockatrice` -> `Cockatrice`, etc). #2419 
- Keyboard shortcuts for create related cards. #2426 
- Font-size cap removed. #2427 
- Folder names in uploaded decks fixed. #2432 
- Undo Condensed Card counter menu. #2433 
    -  May be revisited for options in the future.
- Buddy room filter checkbox fixed. #2434 
- Fix incorrect pawns shown in PMs. #2436 
- Show games for yourself is now an option. #2437 
- Download replays alerts when trying to download folder. #2442 
    - May be revisited in the future
- Related tokens will now trigger the last token made option. #2455 
- Close connection dialog when resetting passwords. #2458 
- Ignore message now more explicit. #2459 
- Rephrase missing feature setting. #2462 

### Translations

**Thanks for over 100 people contributing to many different translations in the meantime!**

Without the help of the community we couldn't offer that great language support... keep up the good work!
It's actually very easy to join and help for yourself - find out more here:
[**Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!**](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

### Under the Hood
- Backend email blocks. #2352 
- Added support for RPM. #2373 
- Fix crash if no TrayIcon on system. #2415 
- Remove ambiguity from code. #2418 
- Make sure XML is uploaded for databases. #2440 
- Sending a message in main chat, game chat, or PM chat will reset idle timer. #2456
- Cmake support for OpenSSL 1.1. #2461 

### Servatrice
- Custom notify user events. #2398 
- Log filter description was wrong. #2421 
- Server audit table. #2423 

### Webatrice
- More user friendly fields. #2363 
- URLs now open in a new tab. #2439 

## Special Thanks

We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ZeldaZach @tritoch @ctrlaltca and @woogerboy21 for their continued support of Cockatrice development. If you'd like to contribute towards Cockatrice, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-).

## Upgrading Cockatrice

If you're running an older version of Cockatrice, to update your client, simply download the pre-compiled binaries at the bottom of these release notes.

:warning: :new: If you use **Mac OS X 10.9 or earlier**, you will need to either upgrade your OS or build and compile yourself following our [wiki instructions](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Compiling-Cockatrice-%28macOS%29). :warning: If you still use Windows XP, you will need to install using the package tagged "win32."

After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) (run <kbd>Oracle</kbd>).

## Changelog

### User Interface
- Gummy minor changes (again). #2336 
- Fix game replays. #2340 
- Condense card menu. #2348 
- Added privlevel to user details. #2349 

### Translations
- [**Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!**](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

### Under the Hood
- Updated mac wording for bintray deployment. #2359

### Servatrice
- Add configuration to enable/disable internal smtp client. #2337 
- Add email registration restriction. #2350 

## Special Thanks

We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ZeldaZach @ctrlaltca @woogerboy21 @tooomm @poixen and @Daenyth for their continued support of Cockatrice development. If you'd like to contribute towards Cockatrice, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-).

name: Cockatrice: "All Hallow's Eve"
body:
## General Notes

We're pleased to announce the newest official release: <kbd>**Cockatrice: All Hallow's Eve**</kbd>! We hope you enjoy the changes made, and we have listed all changes since the last Revision of Cockatrice was released, with their corresponding tickets, for your convenience.

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues). ([How to create a GitHub Ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/How-to-Create-a-GitHub-Ticket))

For any information relating to Cockatrice, please take a look at our official site: **https://cockatrice.github.io**

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works and how you can provide a meaningful contribution.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

If you're running a version of Cockatrice built on or after May 9th, 2016 go to <kbd>Help → Update Cockatrice</kbd> and you'll be taken through the update steps in client. If you're running an older version of Cockatrice, to update your client, simply download the pre-compiled binaries at the bottom of these release notes.

:warning: :new: If you use **Mac OS X 10.9 or earlier**, you will need to upgrade your OS as Cockatrice will only compile and run on Mac OS X 10.10 and newer. We no longer build for 10.9 as Travis has changed their build processes.

:warning: If you still use Windows XP, you will need to install using the package tagged "win32."

After you have updated your client, please [update your card database](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#how-do-i-update-my-card-database-to-have-the-latest-cards) (run <kbd>Oracle</kbd>).

## Changelog

### User Interface
- Filter out 'buddy only' games. #2049, #2080 
- Room age more standardized. #2071 
- Login popup layout re-arranged. #2083, #2100 
- Local games crash fixes. #2096 
- More gameplay room. #2103 
- Game creation can now only have one type. #2115 
- Æ → Ae changes applied globally (MTGJSON changes too). #2182, #2185 
- Disable "Load remote deck..." button in local game. #2199 
- Update wordings on missing feature dialogs. #2246 

### Translations
- **Fully translated**
  - English
  - Chinese (Simplified)
  - German
  - Italian
- Above **90%** translated
  - Portuguese
  - Russian
  - Spanish
  - Japanese
  - French 
- Above **50%** translated
  - Korean
  - Portuguese (Brazil)
  - Polish
  - Swedish
- Still in the works
  - Dutch
  - Serbian
  - Estonian
  - Czech
  - Pirate English
  - Norwegian Bokmål
- [**Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!**](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

### Deck Editor
- HTML parsed out when pasting in deck title. #2082 
- Power/toughness filters added. #2169 

### Gameplay
- Timestamps now contain seconds. #2045 
  - [hh:mm] => [hh:mm:ss]

### Under the Hood
- Moderators have moderation powers enabled on login. #2046 
- Clipboard pasting issues addressed. #2125 
  - New default shortcut for "paste from clipboard": <kbd>CTRL+SHIFT+V</kbd>
  - Current value not overrided, but on "reset" will be changed
- Exporting decks more linear. #2126 
- Optimize card move between main/side in deck editor. #2132 
- !setnumber! is now !collectornumber!. #2134 
- Prevent additional login error popups. #2195 
- Idle client timeout. #2209, #2244 
- Code cleanup. #2222 

### Servatrice
- Shutdown timer will now show every half time instead of every 10 minutes. #2084 
  - Ex: 120min until shutdown → 60 min → 30 min → 15 min → 7 min → etc.
- ClientID generation changes based on serverIP. #2087
- Respect server ID (helpful for potential multiserver). #2099, #2111 
- Disallow usernames via phrase/regex. #2200 
- User privilege levels added. #2228 
- Bug fixes. #2236 

### Webatrice
- Minor fixes to webatrice. #2077, #2114, #2117, #2225 

## Special Thanks

We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ZeldaZach @ctrlaltca @woogerboy21 @tooomm and @Daenyth for their continued support of Cockatrice development. If you'd like to contribute towards Cockatrice, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-).

name: Cockatrice: "The Shadows"
body:
## General Notes

After numerous months with many volunteers pitching in their skills to further Cockatrice, we're pleased to announce the newest official release; <kbd>**Cockatrice: The Shadows**</kbd>! We hope you enjoy the changes made, and we have listed all changes since the last Revision of Cockatrice was released, with their corresponding ticket(s), for your convenience.

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues). ([How to create a GitHub Ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/How-to-Create-a-GitHub-Ticket))

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in anyway, [check out our README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

:warning: Due to a change in BinTray API, the auto-updater on "Cockatrice: Gatewatchers" (Released February 2nd, 2016) and versions of Cockatrice through May 9th, 2016 will not work properly. We have pushed a fix for the auto-updater and hope to allow you to use it in the future.

To update your client to "Cockatrice: The Shadows" go to our BinTray or download at the bottom of these release notes.

:warning: If you use Mac OS X 10.8 or earlier, you will need to upgrade your OS as Cockatrice will only compile on Mac OS X 10.9 and newer

:warning: If you use Windows Vista or earlier, you will need to update your operating system as we no longer support those versions of Windows.

Please re-run <kbd>Oracle</kbd> after upgrading your client. Some of the changes made require additional information added to your <kbd>cards.xml</kbd> database, which will be automatically added once you run the program.

## Changelog

### Notable Changes
- Card database now progressively loads to avoid excessive CPU usage. #1859 
  - Will also alert user if  the database is corrupt and how to install a new one
  - Ability to edit sets/tokens outside of deck editor
  - User created tokens saved to a different file to prevent overwrites by Oracle
- Permissive loading of XMLs (fixes bug with tokens not working properly on older clients). #1901 
- Can now use <kbd>!setnumber!</kbd> in custom download URLs. #1921 
- Client uses gender neutral text to avoid excessive translations. #1949 

### User Interface
- Create game dialog bug fixes. #1794
- Import your own XML databases with ease. #1796 
- Shortcut menu corrections. #1799 
- Game tabs will save their custom sizes as defined by the user. #1807 
- Token creation dialog will now have P/T view-able without scrolling over. #1877 
- Remove all elements of price generation. #1880 
- Card mention in chat bug fixes. #1920 
- Card popup size fixed based on client dimensions. #1930 
- About menu link changes. #1949 

### Translations
- **Fully translated**
  - English
  - German
  - Italian
  - French
- Above **90%** translated
  - Spanish
  - Japanese
- Above **50%** translated
  - Korean
  - Russian
  - Polish
  - Portuguese
- Below **50%** translated
  - Swedish
  - Chinese
  - Dutch
- [**Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!**](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

### Deck Editor
- Deck viewer will save custom column sizes and layouts. #1900 

### Under the Hood
- Replay maintenance scripts updated. #1803 
- Change MySQL schema to Innodb over MyIsam. #1808 
- Windows XP still ~somewhat~ supported through custom compiling. #1819 
- Linux 64-bit custom compiling fixes. #1828 
- Sounds and Themes are now stored within the Cockatrice app. #1832 
- Crash fixes for moderator notifications. #1834 
- Prevent notifications from crashing user. #1866 
- Unique ClientID generation to prevent cross server clashing. #1894 
- "New sets found" dialog bug fixes. #1944 
- Fix auto-updater for Bintray API #1974 

### Servatrice
- Two new options; <kbd>requireemail</kbd> and <kbd>requireemailaction</kbd> for verification. #1873 

## Special Thanks

We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @ctrlaltca @zebington @tooomm @woogerboy21 @leematos @ZeldaZach and @Daenyth for their continued support of Cockatrice development. If you'd like to contribute towards Cockatrice, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-).

name: Cockatrice: "Gatewatchers"
body:
## General Notes

After numerous months with many volunteers pitching in their skills to further Cockatrice, we're pleased to announce the newest official release; <kbd>**Cockatrice: Gatewatchers**</kbd>! We hope you enjoy the changes made, and we have listed all changes since the last Revision of Cockatrice was released, with their corresponding ticket(s), for your convenience.

:tada: Furthermore, we'd like to showcase to you the official website for all things related to Cockatrice, **https://cockatrice.github.io!** You'll be able to download binaries, learn more about what Cockatrice is, and how to get troubleshooting help. We hope you enjoy this and [leave us feedback](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues) as we're always looking to improve!

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues).

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in anyway, [check out our README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

We now host all compiled binaries on BinTray. You can **download** the newest version from there.

Users who are on Mac OS X 10.8 or earlier will need to [compile their own binaries](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Compiling-Cockatrice#on-os-x) as BinTray compiles on OS X 10.9.

:warning: Please re-run <kbd>Oracle</kbd> after upgrading your client. Some of the changes made require additional information added to your <kbd>cards.xml</kbd> database, which will be automatically added once you run the program.

Cockatrice now has a built in feature to update itself. While the feature is still in beta development, we've published it for you to have access and help us determine a reasonable schedule for releases!

## Changelog

### Notable Changes
- Tokens can now be created from their respective cards. #1722, #1734, #1735 
- **Client can now check for updates and download them (via help menu actions).** #1727, #1776 
  - [**Click here for more info!**](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Updating-Cockatrice)
- Game tab & Replay tabs dockified (like the deck editor). #1753 
- We have an official website! https://cockatrice.github.io

### User Interface
- Rooms list columns now have no bounds. #1699 
- Gear icon next to settings (Win/Linux only). #1715 
- Replay progress bar fixed (would break on long replays). #1758

### Translations Status
- **Fully translated**
  - English
  - German
  - Italian
- Above **90%** translated
  - Spanish
  - Japanese
  - Korean
  - French
- Above **50%** translated
  - Polish
  - Portuguese
  - Swedish
- Below **50%** translated
  - Russian
  - Chinese
  - Dutch
- [**Help us Translate Cockatrice into your native language!**](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

### Sound
- Volume controls should work as expected now. #1603 
- Sounds added for buddy logging in/out. #1767 
  - See our wiki entry on [Sound Themes](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Sound-themes) to learn about customizing this.

### Deck Editor
- "*.txt" files are included in the standard deck editor file filter, so you can load them without changing it. #1705 

### Gameplay
- Revert chat stealing focus on key press, allowing more shortcuts to work. #1615 
- Defaults to playing cards on the stack. #1658  
- Rolling a 2 sided dice will print text as a coin flip (still including the number). #1723 

### Oracle
- Defaults to secure connection. #1761 
- Follow URL redirects (if needed). #1763 

### Themes
- Fix Velvet-Marble theme having two images swapped in the move to customizable themes. #1697 

### Under the Hood
- Warnings table syntax updates. #1569, #1588 
- QT libraries bundled for Mac builds. #1620 
- JoinRoom command restructuring. #1637  
- Database speedups. #1721, #1770 
- Appveyor building scripts for BinTray. #1589, #1618, #1627, #1708 
- Travis building script updates. #1608, #1650 

### Servatrice
- Card stacking for morphs fixed. #1654 
- Servatrice schema validation scripts. #1688 
- Login error message upgraded. #1698 
- Crash prevention measures. #1700, #1714, #1717 

## Special Thanks

We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @Ctrlaltca @Tooomm @Woogerboy21 @ZeldaZach @Daenyth and @TmiguelT for their continued support of Cockatrice development. If you'd like to contribute towards Cockatrice, check out our [README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-).

name: Cockatrice: "Expeditions"
body:
## Welcome Message

After almost three months of numerous volunteers pitching in their skills to further Cockatrice, we're pleased to announce the newest official release: <kbd>**Cockatrice: Expeditions**</kbd>! We hope you enjoy the changes made, and we have listed all changes since the last Revision of "Cockatrice: Lightning Angel" was released, with their corresponding ticket(s), for your convenience.

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues).

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in anyway, [check out our README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

You can **download** the newest version of Cockatrice and Oracle from the Cockatrice download page hosted by [**WoogerWorks**](http://www.woogerworks.com).


Please re-run <kbd>Oracle</kbd> after upgrading your client. Some of the changes made require additional information added to your <kbd>cards.xml</kbd> database, which will be automatically added once you run the program. In addition, <kbd>tokens.xml</kbd> is now automatically downloaded when you run <kbd>Oracle</kbd>, so you no longer have download the tokens manually.

:warning:  **Please also note that this update may be mandatory depending on the server operator as we have added a way for server operators to set minimum requirements for connection.**

## Changelog

### Notable Changes
- Username mention completer. #1356, #1394  
- Customizable shortcuts. #1382, #1523 
- Quick server connection list. #1307 
- Log out old sessions when logging in. #1400 
- Theme manager (beta). #1081, #1511 
- Chat history presented on joining a room. #1510 
- Moderator warnings. #1522 
- In-client chat log viewer. #1541 

### User Interface
- Client no longer maximized by default. #1369 
- Add option to open `customsets` folder. #1376 
- Permission levels added to rooms. #1379 
- Cardwidget not showing PT/Loyalty fixed. #1386 
- Admins can promote/demote user ranks. #1391 
- Update Error 11 wording. #1345, #1350 
- Opt-out of remember game settings. #1407 
- Window size no longer changes when clicking a notification. #1485 
- Private message tabs no longer close on disconnect. #1474 
- Setting icons don't bunch up when changing languages. #1497
- Offline user data is now accessible. #1502 
- Shortcut fixes. #1501 
- Moderators are notified of server bans and warnings via server account. #1527 

### Translations
- Updated translations. #1488 

### Sound
- Sound engine overhaul. #1498 
- Sound themes (beta). #1512 

### Deck Editor
- Filters have clear single / clear all buttons again. #1483 

### Gameplay
- Popups in game no longer go off screen when dragging them around. #1496 

### Under the Hood
- Script to validate/clear invalid country flags. #1366, #1367, #1414 
- `last_login` added to user table. #1378 
- Reg only server cleanup. #1346 
- Server ignores registered features if auth mode is "none." #1354 
- Login protocol extended to pass client version string to server at login. #1417 
- Protobuf compiler warning cleanup. #1421
- Prevent invalid bans. #1444 
- Creation of portable builds possible now. #1399 
- Better user analytics. #1473 
- Server bans no longer cause crashes. #1502 
- Fix crash on loading invalid databases. #1555 

### Servatrice
- Option to disable replay storage. #1361 
- Ban by client ID. #1374 
- Added server/client feature communications. #1439 
- Moderators can view user ban history in client. #1469 

## Special Thanks

We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @Woogerboy21 @Ctrlaltca @Daenyth @Zeldazach and @Marcofernandezheras for their continued support of Cockatrice development. If you'd like to contribute towards Cockatrice,  [check out our README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works.

## Special Thanks

name: Cockatrice: "Lightning Angel" (Revision 1)
body:
## Upgrading Cockatrice

:warning: **Warning:** If you have not upgraded your client in the past to `Cockatrice: Summer Magic`, which was released on `June 26th, 2014`, and you're using the Windows operating system, then please backup your decks before updating.

If you downloaded Cockatrice on or after **`July 1st, 2014`**, simply **download** the newest version of Cockatrice and Oracle from the Cockatrice download page hosted by [**WoogerWorks**](http://www.woogerworks.com).

Note: You should re-run `Oracle` after upgrading your client. Some of the changes made require additional information added to your `cards.xml` database, which will be automatically added once you run the program. In addition, `tokens.xml` is now automatically downloaded when you run `Oracle`, so you no longer have to do this manually.

## Changelog

name: Cockatrice: "Lightning Angel"
body:
## Welcome Message

After a long year of numerous volunteers pitching in their skills to further Cockatrice, we're pleased to announce the newest official release: <kbd>**Cockatrice: Lightning Angel**</kbd>! Compared to what `Cockatrice: Summer Magic` brought, our newest version contains almost _1300_ new commits building on what was laid down in the past. We hope you enjoy the changes made, and we have listed them all below, with their corresponding ticket(s), for your convenience.

If you ever encounter a bug, have a suggestion or idea, or feel a need for a developer to look into something, please feel free to [open a ticket](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/issues).

If you'd like to help contribute to Cockatrice in anyway, [check out our README](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice#get-involved-). We're always available to answer questions you may have on how the program works.

## Upgrading Cockatrice

:warning: **Warning:** If you have not upgraded your client in the past to `Cockatrice: Summer Magic`, which was released on `June 26th, 2014`, and you're using the Windows operating system, then please backup your decks before updating. 

There was a bug that would delete `Program Files/Cockatrice`, which contains your decks files, in versions of Cockatrice released before `Cockatrice: Summer Magic`.

If you downloaded Cockatrice on or after **`July 1st, 2014`**, simply **download** the newest version of Cockatrice and Oracle from the Cockatrice download page hosted by [**WoogerWorks**](http://www.woogerworks.com).

Note: You should re-run `Oracle` after upgrading your client. Some of the changes made require additional information added to your `cards.xml` database, which will be automatically added once you run the program.

## Changelog

### Notable Changes
- System tray icon. Can be used to alert about PMs/mentions. #847, #912
- Card preview windows freezing should now be fixed. #508 
- Private Messages from unregistered users can be blocked. #660
- Games with passwords will now show by default in the search. #695
- You can disable notifications for games you're spectating. #765 
- Oracle imports all sets and you can enable/disable them from in client. #985 
  - The system also alerts you when a new set is released.
- Support for Mac retina display. #1027 
- In client registration. #1101 
- Create the transformations for Flip Cards & Transform Cards easily. #1134 
- You can set your own card image download URL.  #1141 

### User Interface
- Game types are now shown in tab. #1087 
- Updated filter images. #1061 
- Simplified replay interface. #936 
- Account age can be seen for registered users in the "User Details" window. #534
- Able to join games/rooms with double clicking or pressing return. #454, #461 
- New default card back image. #345
- Allow for saving of data and auto connect to server upon opening client. #289 
- Updated default play, stack and hand zone colors. #379
- New logo for client and server. #358, #1024
- New alert icon for tabs. #712 
- New ready/not ready icons. #789 
- Fixed setting icon positions. #538
- Reduce white space on game descriptions. #671
- Added title for sound settings subsection. #553
- Updated Chat Settings tab. #554 
- Username is now shown in the title bar when logged in. #795 
- Re-check the "shuffle when closing" option when viewing the library. #645
- Filters will save from session to session. #523 
- Viewing players active games will no longer filter results. #710 
- Changing set order is now much, much easier. #471
- Separator between the connection features and the others in the Connect tab. #648 
- New flags that are all the same size standard. #615  
  - See what country each flag is from in the user info panel. #623 
- Updated game list layout. #580
  - Password column has been replaced with an image/text in the Restrictions column.
  - Creator user level image is now visible in Creator column.
  - Spectator column now shows if spectators can chat and see hands. #713, #715 
- ToolTip on replays now all have a layout name. #502
- Creation of `CUSTOM` folder to override default card images. #246
  - [How to use the CUSTOM folder](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Custom-Card-Images#follow-these-steps-if-you-do-want-to-use-the-custom-folder-to-manually-add-custom-card-images)
- You can view the `CUSTOM` folder from Deck Editor tab. #955
- OS X header remains constant when changing language preferences. #702 
- User level pawns have a refreshed appearance. #717 
- Tabs with updates in them have a new icon. #733 
- Re-sized game view column widths. #839 
- Game menu where seeing what games player is in is now larger. #840 
- Reformatted text fonts throughout the client. #860 
- Failed logins will now pull up the login menu. #879 
- Updated add/remove buttons in Chat Settings. #1016 
- Fixed battlefield area positioning in multicolumn layout. #1034 
- Date of build now shown next to version number. #1046
- Rolling dialog now has icon. #1065
- You can run Oracle from inside Cockatrice now. #1039 
  - You are also informed when new sets are available.

### Translations
- Support for Korean Translations. :kr: #518, #572, #616, among others.
- Oracle now has translations. #709
- [Help us translate Cockatrice!](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)

### Chat
- Auto url tagging. [url] can be used, but not required. ##1078
- Buddies can now be seen with a star in the main chat. #654 
- When mentioned in chat with `@your_username` that line will be highlighted. #535, #609, #770, #870
- Receive an alert when you're `@mentioned`. #636 
  - Can be disabled in settings.
- Able to change username and mention color in the Chat Settings. #644 
- When another user is mentioned in chat they are highlighted and can be interacted with. #578
- Clicking on a username in room or game chat will add an `@their_username` mention to the line edit. #562
- Ctrl+Click on a username opens private chat with them. #727 
- Added time stamps to games in chat rooms. #436, #758
- Added time stamps to phase changes and messages in game. #527
- Chat will now be focus when starting a game. #676 
- Added underline to URL links. #463
- Chat Settings can now be accessed via the chat settings gear. #567
- Chat can now be cleared from the chat settings gear or pressing `F12`. #543, #836
- Option to block private chat from unregistered users. #611
- Opening direct chat with a user will reuse an existing chat tab instead of making a new tab. #689 
- Cog wheel changed from dull grey to blue. #878

### Sound
- Updated client sound #1055 
  - New settings tab
  - Master volume slider
  - Replaced all old sounds
  - Removed untap/phase change/shuffle/draw/play card sounds
  - Added end phase sound

### Deck Editor
- Partial search results. #416
  - Ex: Searching for "goyf" will show both Tarmogoyf and Lhurgoyf.
- Improved search filtering. #796, #809, #849, #920, #1040 
- Search by CMC is now a field option. #634, #638 
- Removal of BlackLotusProject pricing. #481 
- Price column removed if pricing is disabled. #236 
- Deckstats.net feature works correctly again and now supports deck name. #672
- Buttons that alter the card contents in a deck have been re-ordered & re-colored. #679 
- Support for card color filters improved. #748 
  - Ex: You can now search for green cards by typing "green", "g", and/or "grn."
- Will ask to save before closing down the client for each deck. #772 
- Deckbrew pricing removed. #882 
- Columns no longer diverge when changing sorting. #910
- Filtering now uses cache to speed up response times. #974
- Card text will highlight once added to deck for convenience. #1115
- Oracle text can now be viewed at the same time as image. #1137 

### Gameplay
- Solid counters. #1155 
- Reduced min width. #1156 
- Reveal zones are now resizable windows. #1053 
- Default reveal zone positions updated to prevent overlapping. #1045
- Power and Toughness will now change color if different from the database base. #1005 
- Users can now "Target cast" from hand. #881 
- Inactive users play area will be faded to make it easier to determine who is the active player. #379
- Unsorted card view zones can be sorted into pile view. #549
- Repositioned filer boxes to save vertical space. #1047 
- Reveal top card of deck `Ctrl + N`. #929 
- Card view zone check boxes are now remembered after closing. #523 
- When kicked from a game, you are informed via a modal popup. #697 
- Tokens are now created with P/T from `tokens.xml` if available. #336, #940 
- Tokens added to deck work properly. #938 
- Tokens menu updated to increase information showing. #937
- Added card "ghost" when dragging cards. #450
- Card animation uses additional frames and tap faster. #378, #592 
- Changing phases is now faster. #378
- The count of each card type is shown on the deck preview screen in games. #483
- Added deck context menu item: "Put bottom card in graveyard". #435
  - You can still **Ctrl + Drag** from the deck to drag the bottom card.
- Cards scale up when mousing over. Can be disabled in settings. #433, #846 
- Reset the "Always reveal top card" check box when starting a new game. #520
- Sub-menus to move around cards quicker. #597
- Game creation preferences saved. #199 
- HQ Card images are downloaded by default. #729 
- **Ctrl + Click** on a card toggles group selection. #735
- Cards in hand have a "Play face down" context menu action. #726 
- New icons for player/spectators. #760, #761 
- It's no longer possible to drag the zone view widget off screen where you can't drag it again. #773
- Cards played face down will always go to the first row now. #775 
- Game actions have a distinct color. #800
- Card boarders have been cleaned up. #845, #898 
- When middle-clicking on life total, options now from positive to negative. #896
- Middle clicking a counter then clicking away will no longer change the counter value. #897 
- Local play will now default to one player. #902 
- Left hand justification is now an option (Disabled by default).  #901
- Creatures can now have negative power. #939
- Storm counter is now orange to distinguish it from colorless. #987 
- Cards with P/T not matching the database will appear orange. #1005, #1022 
  - Useful for when a creature has +1/+1 counters, you animate a land, etc.
- You can "manifest" a card. #1035
- You can now reveal X amount of cards to target player(s). #1051 
- `tokens.xml` now supports `<tablerow>`. #1166
- New card viewer from deck editor now in game tab. #1153 

### Oracle
- Now supports language preferences. #709 
  - [Help us translate Oracle!](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/wiki/Translation-FAQ)
- Allow for ZIP'd JSON files to be parsed properly. #667, #738
- Inform user of `cards.xml` save location for future reference. #610
- Inform users it's necessary to run to have a full database of cards. #602 
- Default URL download button (to http://mtgjson.com) built in. #419
- Tokens no longer overwritten by the `cards.xml`. #238
- Users are informed to run Oracle before starting. #639 
- Progress bar to show download status. #767 
- Updated Icons. #925, #1024
- Parsing has been improved. #1162 
- Oracle is now in HD. #1168 

### Under the Hood
- Memory usage has been improved and some memory leaks fixed in both Cockatrice and Servatrice. #274, #279, #498, among others.
- Refactoring code base to improve service speed. #556, #607
- Install required QTPlugins on any kind of install, including Debug. #507 
- Fix crash on close. #501 
- OSX now has a proper `.plist` file set for Cockatrice. #418
- Removal of `.full` from card images as unnecessary. #280 
- Supporting both `.png` and `.jpg` image formats. #214 
- Prevent cards from double loading once loaded initially. #751 
- QT 5.0.3 is the minimum required for Linux distros. #755 
  - We recommend QT 5.4+ for the best results.
- Fix Mac OSX issue when compiling using CLion. #769 
- Cleanup scripts to maintain databases. #787 
- Revert High Quality image check box. #815 
  - MTGImage.com was closed.
- Script to create base admin account. #801
- Large decks (up to 8000 cards) have a fail-safe to prevent crashes. #911 
- Main chat lag reduced by simplification of SVGs. #945 
- Unregistered users have name restrictions. #956
- Sound engine improvements. #1075 
- Docs updated as we use the GitHub Wiki now. #1079
- You can now load multiple card databases. #1088 
- Migration services are now functional. #1124 
- Allow same room names to be used across multiple services. #1121 

### Servatrice
- Server shutdown warnings changed from 1 min → 10 mins. #1010 
- Database logging over file logging. Configurable through Servatrice settings file. #519 
- Servatrice informs users how old an account is when asking for user info. #534
- Servatrice will allow unlimited connections for certain, configurable, IP ranges. #441
  - Useful for things like universities and colleges.
- Allow for registered-only server. Configurable through Servatrice settings file. #179 
- Log file will be auto generated if not found. #682 
- Servatrice should use less memory and cause less load on the database. #707 
- Will now throw back server user rules on error. #1205 

## Special Thanks

We continue to find it amazing that so many people contribute their time, knowledge, code, testing and more to the project. We'd like to thank the entire Cockatrice community for their efforts, and we'd like to especially recognize @Daenyth @Poixen @Ctrlaltca @ZeldaZach and @Woogerboy21 for their continued support of Cockatrice development.

name: Cockatrice: "Summer Magic"
body:
# Summer Magic 2014

## Notable Changes
- The deck editor has been updated to have new filters and a new look
- Oracle now uses mtgjson.com instead of Gatherer and has a new look as well as improved speed
- You now have the ability to friend or ignore offline users in the User Lists tab
- Servatrice now uses Fischer-Yates shuffle.
- MSVC is now the officially supported mechanism for compiling on Windows.
- The format for cards.xml has changed and will require you to rerun Oracle
- Downloading HQ pictures is now a settings checkbox (off by default)
- User manual is updated
- Cockatrice gives sane warning messages for various card database issues instead of displaying settings page and refusing to launch
- OSX DMG generation is improved
- Cockatrice's github repository is now integrated with Travis CI for better build assurance

## Known Issues
- The new deck editor is rough around the edges. A specific list is here: #97. Please add unmentioned issues in that ticket.
- The translations are going to be out of date
- Some set codes have changed from the new source, which means that card images might need to be redownloaded. **If you are under bandwidth caps** you are highly encouraged to manually correct these to avoid downloading card images you already have. See #114 for specifics. This note can be ignored by most people because Cockatrice will automatically download the images again. 
- If you downloaded or compiled a prerelease version of the client you should rerun Oracle.

## Special Thanks

All the people who have contributed their time, knowledge, code, testing to the project. The project wouldn't be nearly as vibrant as it is now without all your help. Special thanks (in no particular order) to @woogerboy21, @VanNostrand, @ctrlaltca, @DMBuce, @mattkelly, and @sylvan-basilisk!

## Future Roadmap

Tickets for the release after this one can be watched on [the issue page](https://github.com/Daenyth/Cockatrice/issues?direction=desc&milestone=2&page=1&sort=updated&state=open)

## Specific Changelog

[Git shortlog](https://gist.github.com/Daenyth/2151dfe586ff71ea04ce)
